text: Groom’s Praise of His Bride
⸤Oh my⸥!\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Literally “Behold!” Or “Look!” \f* You \add are\add* beautiful, my beloved!
⸤Oh my⸥!\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Literally “Behold!” Or “Look!” \f* You \add are\add* beautiful!
Your eyes \add are\add* doves
from behind your veil.
Your hair \add is\add* like a flock of goats
that move down from the mountains of Gilead.
Your teeth \add are\add* like a flock of shorn ewes
that came up from the washing,
all of them bearing twins,
and there is none bereaved among them.
Your lips \add are\add* like a thread of crimson,
and your mouth \add is\add* lovely.
Your temple \add is\add* like pomegranate
from behind your veil.
Your neck \add is\add* like the tower of David,
built in courses;
a thousand ⸤ornaments⸥\f + \fr 4:4 \ft Literally “shields” \f* are hung on it,
all the shields of the warriors.
Your two breasts \add are\add* like two fawns,
twins of a gazelle that feed among the lilies.
Until the day breathes and the shadows flee,
I will go to the mountain of the myrrh,
to the hill of the frankincense.
You \add are\add* completely beautiful, my beloved!
⸤You are flawless⸥!\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Literally “There is no flaw in you!” \f*
The Mountains and Fragrance of Lebanon
Come\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Or “You must come” \f* with me from Lebanon, my bride!
Come with me\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Or “With me” \f* from Lebanon!
Look from the top of Amana,
from the top of Senir and Hermon,
from the dwelling places of the lions,
from the mountains of leopard.
You have stolen (my) heart, my sister bride!
You have stolen \add my\add* heart with one \add glance\add* from your eyes,
with one ornament from your necklaces.
How beautiful is your love, my sister bride!
How better is your love than wine,
and the fragrance of your oils than any spice!
Your lips drip nectar, \add my\add* bride;
honey and milk \add are\add* under your lips;
the scent of your garments \add is\add* like the scent of Lebanon.
The Locked Garden of Delights Is Unlocked
A garden locked \add is\add* my sister bride,
a spring enclosed,\f + \fr 4:12 \ft Or “a source locked” \f* a fountain sealed.
Your shoots\f + \fr 4:13 \ft Or “your channel” \f* \add are\add* an orchard of pomegranates with ⸤choice fruit⸥,\f + \fr 4:13 \ft Literally “fruit of choice things” \f*
henna with nard;
nard and saffron, calamus and cinnamon spice with all trees of frankincense,
myrrh and aloes with all chief spices.
A garden fountain, a well of living water,
flowing (streams) from Lebanon.
Awake, O north wind! Come, O south wind!
Blow upon my garden! Let its fragrances\f + \fr 4:16 \ft Or “perfumes” \f* waft forth!\f + \fr 4:16 \ft Or “His perfumes can waft down” \f*
Let my beloved come to his garden,
let him eat his choice fruit!
